com.esri.mo2.data.feat
Class BaseRow

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.data.feat.BaseRow
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Data, Identifiable, Row
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseFeature
public class BaseRow
extends Object
implements Row

This class is the standard implementation of Row.

Before you use a BaseRow object, you must call the setFields method with a valid Fields object. The Fields are not duplicated, but only a reference is stored. This is to save space, because all Features stored within the Feature MemoryCache would otherwise have a duplicate of exactly the same Fields. Clearly, care must be taken when using the Fields object.

Specified by:

Returns:

See Also:
setFields(com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Fields)

setFields

public void setFields(Fields f)
Sets the given Fields in the Row. Invoking this method will reset the size of the Values collection. If the BaseRow already has Fields and Values, then an attempt is be made to preserve existing Values for corresponding Fields (both before and after).

Parameters:
f - the fields

getValues

public Object[] getValues()
Returns the array of values. You must invoke setFields() first to ensure the Value collection is set correctly.

Returns:
an array of values as objects
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if setFields() has not been called

getDisplayValue

public String getDisplayValue(int index)
Description copied from interface: Row
A helper method that returns a displayable form of the given value. This method uses the getValue to obtain the value, and then calls the Field.format method to produce the String.

setValues

public void setValues(Object[] values)
